body:
it is probably not large_unary only. I started to see the intensive
failures across different interop test cases from early afternoon.

On Fri, Feb 20, 2015 at 12:57 AM, Yang Gao notifications@github.com wrote:

> Donna found this issue. Clients in java and go cause the same problem.
> It may be from a recent change (Donna mentioned something like it was
> passing on Wed.)
> 
> I first thought it was caused by the cancellation support on c++ server
> side pr#581. But I might not sync to the correct commit, so now I think it
> is earlier than that.
> 
> A little debugging shows:
> The large_unary call was never obtained from cq->Next() in the c++ server.
> While at the same time other unary calls go through without a problem.
> 
> repro:
> bins/dbg/interop_client --server_port=18365 --test_case=large_unary
> bins/dbg/interop_server --port=18365
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/649.

Taking a look

On Fri, Feb 20, 2015, 01:05 Qi Zhao notifications@github.com wrote:

> it is probably not large_unary only. I started to see the intensive
> failures across different interop test cases from early afternoon.
> 
> On Fri, Feb 20, 2015 at 12:57 AM, Yang Gao notifications@github.com
> wrote:
> 
> > Donna found this issue. Clients in java and go cause the same problem.
> > It may be from a recent change (Donna mentioned something like it was
> > passing on Wed.)
> > 
> > I first thought it was caused by the cancellation support on c++ server
> > side pr#581. But I might not sync to the correct commit, so now I think
> > it
> > is earlier than that.
> > 
> > A little debugging shows:
> > The large_unary call was never obtained from cq->Next() in the c++
> > server.
> > While at the same time other unary calls go through without a problem.
> > 
> > repro:
> > bins/dbg/interop_client --server_port=18365 --test_case=large_unary
> > bins/dbg/interop_server --port=18365
> > 
> > —
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/649.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/649#issuecomment-75208266.

Looks like we're not triggering the transport to accept window updates... this is probably a bug in core and should be simple to solve.

@donnadionne - are we seeing similar problems for node or ruby?
